content:
https://github.com/rust-analyzer/rust-analyzer/runs/4057482871?check_suite_focus=true

Looks like nightlies are down since 27.10.2021 (that's the version I have installed and it does not update for me).

The dist (aarch64-unknown-linux-gnu) release job fails on sudo apt-get install gcc-aarch64-linux-gnu with

 E: Failed to fetch http://security.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/main/b/binutils/binutils-aarch64-linux-gnu_2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04.5_amd64.deb  404  Not Found [IP: 52.250.76.244 80]
E: Unable to fetch some archives, maybe run apt-get update or try with --fix-missing?
Error: Process completed with exit code 100.

Would adding apt-get update into our script help?
Good finding, filed https://github.com/rust-analyzer/rust-analyzer/pull/10671
Thanks!
I'll try to trigger the nightly workflow afterwards
Oh, I think it used the previous revision of the repo. I pushed to trigger-nightly now.
@Laurențiu my guess is that it's that we use ubuntu-18.smth for builders
@Laurențiu do you remember why we aren't just using ubuntu-latest? Is that because of glibc symbol versioning thing?
I remember, but my keyboard is in pieces rn
Yeah, glilbc
Oh, let me update the builders then

I remember, but my keyboard is in pieces rn

What happened? In general, I can hightly recommend split keyboards :D
https://github.com/rust-analyzer/rust-analyzer/pull/10672

Hm, see no trace of a new nightly on https://github.com/rust-analyzer/rust-analyzer/releases or a release job in https://github.com/rust-analyzer/rust-analyzer/actions ?

So this time not even sure what's happening, but we're not there yet.
Maybe ubuntu-latest PR fixes that.

Planned maintenance, I suppose? I got a new keyboard last week, did a foam mod (adding some packaging foam below the PCB), changed the switches but I missed that one of the side switches wasn't working when I put it back, so I had to open it back again
Still putting back the keycaps now :D

About the builder distro.. Some users complained that RA wasn't working on CentOS 7 because of it's awfully old glibc and around that time you downgraded them to 16.04 in https://github.com/rust-analyzer/rust-analyzer/pull/4427. Then I upgraded to 18.04 in https://github.com/rust-analyzer/rust-analyzer/pull/10078 because 16.04 was EOL.
I suspect we'll get some complaints after #10672

matklad said:

I remember, but my keyboard is in pieces rn

What happened? In general, I can hightly recommend split keyboards :D

I can't type on most ergonomic keyboards, but on the topic of hardware, I highly recommend Pozidriv screwdrivers for furniture, at least in Europe (I just used my Wera set and I have one of those in there).

Kirill Bulatov said:

Hm, see no trace of a new nightly on https://github.com/rust-analyzer/rust-analyzer/releases or a release job in https://github.com/rust-analyzer/rust-analyzer/actions ?

So this time not even sure what's happening, but we're not there yet.
Maybe ubuntu-latest PR fixes that.

Oops, I pushed to the wrong remote
https://github.com/rust-analyzer/rust-analyzer/actions/runs/1404472232

Oh no. You know, up to about 25 or so I thought there only two types of screwdrivers: |-like and X-like. And then, after having spent like two days trying to assemble local non-IKEA cabinet with pozidriv screws and philips screwdriver, I googled the thing
IKEA uses Pozidriv too, at least here . But I only found out about it last year. I knew it was a thing, but I probably used Philips before at it more or less worked.

I suspect we'll get some complaints after #10672

Yeah... I wonder what version we should support?
rustc supports some ancient glibc 2.11, I'd imagine that would be a big pain to setup
I thought that changed after https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/62516? Well, if you're on an older distro you can use rustup.
doh, I completely missed https://github.com/rust-analyzer/rust-analyzer/commit/d6c162e40f5efb6e98c6e4223eaf4bbc02cc830c#diff-e426ed45842837026e10e66af23d9c7077e89eacbe6958ce7cb991130ad05ada
I thought that's what we had, and that that didn't work
In principle I'm not opposed to using the latest LTS. That should be old enough for desktop usage and there are other workarounds too.
Yeah, I also feel that "latest ubuntu LTS" is the right option for us. I guess for older distros you can use rustup version?
I think there's an amount of developers saying "I want to use the same environment on my computer as in production", but there's rustup, containers, SSH and so on.
New nightly is out and appears to run on Ubuntu 18.04 too

Had anything changed to the way we publish the extension?

https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=matklad.rust-analyzer says 14/02/2022 under "Last updated", whatever I've tried (switching versions, going to prerelease/stable, uninstallation), I'm still having the rust-analyzer version: 02904e99a 2022-02-14 nightly version installed locally as latest.
Yeah, the VS Code Marketplace access token expired six days ago

Oh, right: https://github.com/rust-analyzer/rust-analyzer/runs/5269348322?check_suite_focus=true
